or application

div.div:
Resource Surveillance (
surveilr
)
A single binary contains all the bootstrap SQL and SQL notebooks to prepare resource databases on Linux, Windows, and MacOS.

switch.text: Resource Surveillance (surveilr)A single binary contains all the bootstrap...

...as many devices
as you have...create as
many files as you need...

surveilr admin merge
surveilr admin merge --sql-only

Aggregation Device
(usually a server) running
surveilr
and
sqlite3

...use any protocol(s) to put the SQLite files from all
the other devices onto an aggregation device...

div.span: is created, the SQLite database is portable and contains full versioned state ready to be queried by any system that supports SQLite (or ETL'd into another DB).

switch.text: Once the Aggregated RSSD is created, the SQLite database is...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 418px; height: 1px; padding-top: 645px; margin-left: 347px;

div.span: All the resources in the SQLite database are in their native formats and can be queried directly in HTML, JSON, Markdown (with Frontmatter), full-text search, etc. and other content sharing capabilities such as https//:contentlayer.dev/.

switch.text: All the resources in the SQLite database are in their native formats and can...

div.span:
is created, the SQLite database is portable and contains full versioned content ready to aggregated and queried.
Because it contains only the resources (content) you requested, it's secure.

switch.text: Once the Device RSSD is created, the...

div.span: ") or execute commands and capture output from osQuery, Mergestat, Steampipe, cnquery.io, or any custom scripts that run on any device connecting to any cloud.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 108px; height: 1px; padding-top: 582px; margin-left: 676px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;

div.font:
Query the device-specific
RSSD files via SQL individually
or aggregate them for combined
querying through SQL.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 228px; height: 1px; padding-top: 532px; margin-left: 59px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: left;
display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Garamond; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

span.style: orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; widows: 2; background-color: rgb(251, 251, 251); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; float: none; display: inline !important;

div.span:
Consider using these SQLite Extensions for enhnaced querying:
sqlite.org/json1.html
lets you use SQL to query JSON1...JSON5 directly in RSSDs.
github.com/asg017/sqlite-html
lets you use SQL to query HTML directly in RSSDs.
github.com/asg017/sqlite-md
lets you use SQL to query Markdown directly in RSSDs.

switch.text: Consider using these SQLite Extensions for...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 406px; margin-left: 660px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0px; text-align: center;

div.font:
`rclone` may be useful to
automate gathering of files
